FileFormat.FormatDescription: A CDX file consists of individual lines of text, each of which summarizes a single web document. The first line in the file is a legend for interpreting the data, and the following lines contain the data for referencing the corresponding pages within the host. The first character of the file is the field delimiter used in the rest of the file. This is followed by the literal "CDX". For signature strength we currently assume the field delimiter will be a space character, however please contact the PRONOM team should you encounter CDX index files where the delimiter is different.
FileFormat.ProvenanceName: Digital Preservation Department / The National Archives

InternalSignature.SignatureNote: BOF: <field delimiter (usually space)>CDX<field delimiter (usually space)>, followed by CDX options as described here: https://archive.org/web/researcher/cdx_file_format.php For signature strength we currently assume the field delimiter will be a space character (hex 0x20) rather than a wildcard, with scope to add further delimiters as they are encountered.
